name: politico
text:
President Trump today signed into law a bill to impose sanctions on Chinese officials, businesses and banks that help China restrict Hong Kong’s autonomy.

The move is likely to worsen already-strained diplomatic ties and prompt retaliation from Beijing
https://t.co/WmhY0Qi7JN

name: politico
text:
Here we are, mid-summer, and things are going backwards.

Leaving the nation’s coronavirus response to individual states has had catastrophic consequences for America, erasing nearly all the gains the nation made in March and April
https://t.co/ED7eLGLZV3

name: politico
text:
Kansas GOP Rep. Steve Watkins was charged with three felony counts of voter fraud related to the 2019 municipal elections, according to court records

https://t.co/8bTlbnFZWy

name: politico
text:
Watkins, a freshman lawmaker, was charged with “Interference with a law enforcement officer, falsely report a felony intending to obstruct; voting without being qualified; and knowingly mark/transmit more than one advance ballot”

https://t.co/8bTlbnFZWy

name: politico
text:
Watkins also faces a misdemeanor charge of failing to tell the DMV of his address change.

Watkins has acknowledged that he used a UPS store in Topeka for his home address for a 2019 municipal election, according to the Topeka Capitol-Journal
https://t.co/8bTlbnFZWy

name: politico
text:
This dangerous new chapter of the coronavirus outbreak is intensifying calls from politicians and public health experts across the country for a set of national strategies to combat the virus

https://t.co/Ok1pHmEp3i

name: politico
text: BREAKING: Alabama Republicans have chosen a former football coach, Tommy Tuberville, to be the one to attempt to oust Democratic Sen. Doug Jones https://t.co/XmIuy3DVgE

name: politico
text:
For quick, digestible facts and insights on the news of the day, subscribe and start listening to POLITICO Dispatch. 
https://t.co/DPUpEFlsul https://t.co/X9GqksmQcO

name: politico
text: President Trump’s niece has one word of advice for her uncle: “Resign" https://t.co/8iNdHTOm78

name: politico
text:
Trump today turned a news conference about Hong Kong into an extended diatribe against Joe Biden, attributing dozens of policy ideas to him that appeared drawn from opposition research

https://t.co/jiy7mGebA5

name: politico
text:
Seizing on a spike in Covid-19 cases under a Republican governor and Donald Trump’s sliding poll numbers, Joe Biden is venturing into once reliably red terrain — Texas

https://t.co/blfYrwUt7N

name: politico
text:
The Trump administration is resisting calls — even from political allies — to withdraw a proposal to make it more difficult to bring discrimination claims under the Fair Housing Act, even as the nation reckons with racial unrest

https://t.co/ExQYidkfdD

name: politico
text:
It’s taken four months and 7,000 deaths for California Gov. Gavin Newsom and L.A. Mayor Eric Garcetti to go from vanguards to nearly vanquished in the fight against Covid-19

https://t.co/h60By1IE0e

name: politico
text:
The debate over school openings this fall is raging, and the president has challenged his own CDC. Should schools fully reopen in states where coronavirus cases are surging? Stay on top of critical Covid-19 news. Read POLITICO Nightly. Subscribe now.
https://t.co/4vI42TQ6qb https://t.co/62sisYPHoy

name: politico
text: Interpretations of last week’s bombshell ruling in the House’s effort to obtain Trump’s financial records have polarized the legal community and lawmakers https://t.co/KvCYZ2XoM7

name: politico
text: Trump aides face a recurring challenge: Recreate the president’s marquee campaign rallies amid a health crisis without upsetting a boss who views crowd size as a leading metric for evaluating success https://t.co/6CbTsmZVtB

name: politico
text:
Trump’s harsh rhetoric against mail-in voting is causing a big problem for Florida Republicans.

So the state GOP came up with a solution: They doctored one of Trump’s tweets on the issue to remove the stigma. https://t.co/teTvUy5V90

name: politico
text: A majority of voters oppose the Trump administration's demand that K-12 schools and day care centers be fully opened for in-person instruction during the coming academic year https://t.co/NLiqew1RTO
